andy.name: Andy Burris
andy.a2: Slow left turns when they have an arrow
andy.q3: What's the craziest thing you've done in the name of love?

boyce.name: William Boyce V
boyce.highschool: Northern Valley Regional High School at Old Tappan (NVOT)
boyce.a1: The inevitable heat death of the universe
boyce.q2: Fictional character who you self-identify as in your weakest moments
boyce.a3: New Jersey is the best state in the US and Marty and I could easily take over the Northeast in a matter of milliseconds.

cam.name: Cameron Curney
cam.q1: As a team, we don't believe in love at first sight. What are your thoughts on love at five-minute, in-person, one-on-one conversation? Capital T, capital L.
cam.a1: A lotta people have like their first three to five interactions with people scripted.  You really don't start to know a person until meet up number 6.
cam.a2: One time I was about to throw my retainer away in the Ratty, when a random girl, who had seen me take it out before I ate, said, "hey make sure you don't throw away your retainer."  So her.
cam.q3: Do you want your child to be taller than you?
cam.a3: Eh its a hassle being this tall anytime I'm indoors, so it'd likely build character if they were.  I'm going with yes

cleb.name: Caleb Moran
cleb.q1: As a team, we don't believe in love at first sight. What are your thoughts on love at five-minute, in-person, one-on-one conversation? Capital T, capital L.
cleb.a1: The threshold for True Love is unfortunately at the 5-minute-and-11-seconds mark, but once that is achieved, True Love is guaranteed
cleb.q2: Alumni with the most overrrated kids
cleb.a2: Sol’s army of future lawyers are going to destroy the game
cleb.q3: Are you satisfied with the amount of saliva you produce? Explain
cleb.a3: I wish I was drooling exuberant amounts 24/7, enough to feed a family of four

dice.name: Jackson De Campos
dice.q3: What is one thing you will never do again?
dice.a3: I'll never again be wholly entertained by a garbage truck

dyl.name: Dylan Villeneuve
dyl.a1: Nothing beats winning a national championship.
dyl.q2: In the forthcoming BMo documentary, how will you be portrayed?
dyl.a2: Definitely a villain. At least a voice of opposition. Chaos will reign supreme.
dyl.a3: I bought 160 bitcoin in high school and lost the login info. I cry myself to sleep regularly.

graham.name: Graham Huntington
graham.q1: In the forthcoming BMo documentary, how will you be portrayed?
graham.q2: What would you do for Trails if he was in a real pickle?
graham.a2:
1. Crack the jar/barrel/etc 
2. Drain the pickle juice 
3. Locate the pickle in which trails is stuck 
4. Extract trails from said pickle 
5. Eat pickle

ian.name: Ian Layzer
ian.a1: Unlimited breadsticks and Martin ordering the Tour of Italy at Olive Garden.
ian.q2: What do you do outside of BMo?
ian.a2: I've been a TA and HTA for numerous CS classes. I also like to read and play board games with my roommates.
ian.q3: A recent movie you saw + review
ian.a3: Dune: stunning cinematography and design, nailed the feeling of how I imagined Dune, plot was a little underwhelming though

jac.name: Jacques Nissen
jac.q1: A recent movie you saw + review
jac.a1: North by Northwest (Hitchcock Movie). I picked this movie out of the 326 offerings on the plane, and I wish I had picked something else. I had watched this move before when I was around 8 years old and I remember I loved it, but looking back that is probably only because I thought that escaping from criminals by climbing down Mt. Rushmore was the coolest thing in the world. The movie overall was solid (as all Hitchcock's are), but the ending of this one was especially outrageous and incomprehensible. 7/10

john.name: John Randolph
john.q1: What do you do outside of BMo?
john.a2: Chief envoy to the moon people
john.q3: Are you satisfied with the amount of saliva you produce? Explain
john.a3: I am not satisfied. I need enough saliva to eat a pack of saltines in sixty seconds

leo.name: Leo Tamagawa Gordon
leo.q1: What do you do outside of BMo?
leo.a1: Roast fools, multiracial club, ESV, bike without a helmet, paint cards, procrastinate, read books
leo.q2: What's the craziest thing you've done in the name of love?
leo.a2: nothing is crazy if done in the name of love

luca.name: Luca Duclos-Orsello
luca.concentration: International and Public Affairs ; French and Francophone Studies
luca.q2: A recent movie you saw + review
luca.a2: The Guilty - 3/5 -> intriguing, but main character lacked depth/variety of personality traits. Fun twist, but unsurprising that there was going to be a twist. Okay job of tying up loose ends at the end of the movie.

marty.name: Martin Trouilloud
marty.a2: The knowledge that one day I will be proven right about everything completely
marty.q3: A recent movie you saw + review
marty.a3: Luca (the Disney movie) is an unnervingly accurate documentary of Luca Duclos-Orsello’s secret Italian childhood, down to his frightening parents and communist sympathies. Pretty boring!

matias.name: Matias Lee
matias.q1: As a team, we don't believe in love at first sight. What are your thoughts on love at five-minute, in-person, one-on-one conversation? Capital T, capital L.
matias.a1: Love is mereLy a chemical sensaTion, The moLecules in the body working to make you feel good. However, ThaT being said, I do beLieve that one could meet a LoveLy person in a one on one conversaTion.

morgann.name: Morgann Thain
morgann.q1: As a team, we don't believe in love at first sight. What are your thoughts on love at five-minute, in-person, one-on-one conversation? Capital T, capital L.
morgann.a1: I believe in “falling in love” like that, but I don’t think it’s True Love til you spend a lot of time together, know each other, and like internalize caring for each other to the point that you value them similarly to how you value yourself (think of how for some parents, their children are like their purpose and even more important than themselves)
morgann.q2: In the forthcoming BMo documentary, how will you be portrayed?
morgann.a2: Inspiring feel good underdog story where I grind and fail for 3 straight years, each more painful than the last, but then I finally make it my senior year and it’s hype
morgann.a3: English language, specifically questions like “do you mind if…” making you answer with no when you want to affirm them

munch.name: Cal Nightingale
munch.q1: Fictional character who you self-identify as in your weakest moments
munch.q2: In the forthcoming BMo documentary, how will you be portrayed?
munch.a2: Just like Dennis Rodman in The Last Dance
munch.q3: If you were king for a day what law would you impose?
munch.a3: That I'm king for all subsequent days. Boom!

noah.name: Noah Ball-Burack
noah.q1: What do you do outside of BMo?
noah.q2: Alumni with the most overrated kids? Alumni / current player who will have the most overrated kids?
noah.a2: If Cal's kids are rated, this will be done overly
noah.q3: Are you satisfied with the amount of saliva you produce? Explain
noah.a3: Yes, actually. There must be benefits to producing saliva, though I cannot articulate said benefits. Therefore, I would not reduce the amount of saliva I produce. Meanwhile, I would not increase the amount, since I enjoy not spitting on people and stuff.

olow.name: Oscar Low
olow.q2: What is one thing you will never do again?
olow.q3: Fictional character who you self-identify as in your weakest moments

trails.name: Talon Johnson
trails.a1: Blockchain synergy aligns pragmatic quarterly business objectives to forge innovative new strategies for engaging forward-thinking partners in the meta-verse.
trails.q2: Bro, I'm pissed! I'm so pissed!
trails.a2: Yeah, me too. Bottle it up and age it like a fine barolo. One day, it'll be ready to open like a beefy can of whoop-ass.
trails.q3: If you were king for a day what law would you impose?
trails.a3: Schools must bring back the dunce cap and all the dunces will know once more what dummy little dumb dumbs they are.

willis.name: Will Steinfeld
willis.q1: As a team, we don't believe in love at first sight. What are your thoughts on love at five-minute, in-person, one-on-one conversation? Capital T, capital L.
willis.a1: If you have the right conversation topics written on your hand, definitely possible
willis.q2: If you were king for a day what law would you impose?
willis.a2: Large infrastructure investment into chocolate milk/seltzer water fountains
willis.a3: It's not about if you know who you are, it's not about if other people know who you are, it's about if you know who other people know who you are. Everyone knows that.

yut.name: Elliott Rosenberg
yut.q1: In the forthcoming BMo documentary, how will you be portrayed?
yut.a2: The fear of no-nonsense Cal’s wrath
yut.a3: Valet for Frisbee Legend Beau Kittredge

zach.name: Zachary Kaufman
zach.q1: As a team, we don't believe in love at first sight. What are your thoughts on love at five-minute, in-person, one-on-one conversation? Capital T, capital L.
zach.a1: My heart says it's possible, and my brain says it isn't.
zach.q2: You're an aging one-hit-wonder boy band frontman. One day, you get a call from Raja Gosnell, director of the Smurfs multimedia franchise. He wants your band to write the soundtrack for Smurfs 4: Smurfs Fight Back. Five years ago, you'd laugh in his face, but people are starting to forget you. Do you accept?

zuck.name: Kaleb Zuckerman
zuck.q1: Who from a combined roster of BMo and your immediate family would you trade to the Amish for a free trip to Lancaster, PA?
zuck.a1: I would give up the whole team and my entire family just for a trip to Lancaster, PA
zuck.q2: What's the craziest thing you've done in the name of love?
zuck.a2: Bought a $60 blanket for a girl I'd known for 2 weeks. We broke up not long after and I got nothing in return
zuck.a3: I used to hold a Guinness world record for most consecutive frisbee passes
